Posted By: Paleopaladin (8/31/2011 7:25:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Any Dredge deck builder who thinks "OMG this is the perfect card for my deck" inevitably goes through the five stages of Glimpse the Unthinkable Grief:  
1. Denial. "It's okay that this card just gets dredged into my graveyard most of the time. When I draw it, it's going to be killer."  
2. Anger. "WHY DO YOU COUNTER THIS EVERY SINGLE TIME I TRY TO PLAY IT"  
3. Bargaining. "Well, four was too many, but maybe I can keep one or two in the deck, as a surprise?"  
4. Depression. "...doesn't replace [Breakthrough](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Breakthrough), doesn't replace [Careful Study](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Careful Study), doesn't even replace [Tireless Tribe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tireless Tribe) well, there's nothing left in the deck to try to swap out for it anymore..."  
5. Acceptance. "Hey Jerry, I'll trade you eight rares for one -- four Glimpse the Unthinkable and four [Memory Plunder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memory Plunder )  for your Baneslayer..."
posts.html:
Any Dredge deck builder who thinks "OMG this is the perfect card for my deck" inevitably goes through the five stages of Glimpse the Unthinkable Grief:
1. Denial. "It's okay that this card just gets dredged into my graveyard most of the time. When I draw it, it's going to be killer."
2. Anger. "WHY DO YOU COUNTER THIS EVERY SINGLE TIME I TRY TO PLAY IT"
3. Bargaining. "Well, four was too many, but maybe I can keep one or two in the deck, as a surprise?"
4. Depression. "...doesn't replace Breakthrough, doesn't replace Careful Study, doesn't even replace Tireless Tribe well, there's nothing left in the deck to try to swap out for it anymore..."
5. Acceptance. "Hey Jerry, I'll trade you eight rares for one -- four Glimpse the Unthinkable and four Memory Plunder for your Baneslayer..."
